original_title: Sri Lanka bond and t-bill yields up, Rupee at 320/325 against US dollar at close
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s treasury bond yields and t-bills closed higher on Friday while rupee closed weaker at spot market, dealers said.
A 01.07.2025 bond closed at 30.90/31.20 percent on Friday, up from 30.60/31.00 percent on Thursday.
A 15.09.2027 bond closed at 28.00/50 percent, up from 27.80/28.10 percent from Thursday.
The three months’ bill closed at 26.00/30 percent, slightly up from 25.75/26.00 percent.
Sri Lanka rupee closed at 320/325 against the US dollar weaker, from 319/325 from a day earlier. (Colombo/ March24/2023)
